intro: Hemigraphis primulifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or purple shamrock, is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae). It is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage that ranges from deep purple to dark green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Hemigraphis primulifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive leaves and compact growth habit.
